Dated this the 4" day of January, 2018 ORDER Petitioners are accused Nos.1 to 6 in Crime No.531 of 2017 of the Mannarkkad Police Station, registered for the offences punishable under Sections 143, 147, 341 and 323 IPC read with Section 149 IPC. 2. It seems that the matter has been amicably seitled between the parties. 3. On going through the facts and circumstances of the case, it seems that the matter can be permitted to be settled. lt has been reported that no criminal antecedents have been reported against the petitioners. The defacto complainant and the other affected person have filed Annexure-Il and Annexure-lll affidavits affirming that the matter has been amicably settled between them and the petitioners and they have no complaints against the petitioners. Considering the fact that the matter has already been settled amicably between the parties, this court is Peg apa 2018/KER/273 Crl.M.C.No.8844 of 2017 2 satisfied that no purpose would be served in proceeding with the trial of the case. Matters being so, Annexure-I First Information Report in Crime No.531 of 2017 of the Mannarkkad Police Station, and all further proceedings in it, as against the petitioners, are liable to be quashed. In the result, this Cri.M.C. is allowed and Annexure-! First Information Report in Crime No.531 of 2017 of the Mannarkkad Police Station, and all further proceedings in it, as against the petitioners, are hereby quashed. Sd/- B.KEMAL PASHA JUDGE DSV/4/1/18 True Copy / P.A.To Judge
